alert.note: Alert for Bullitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 9:04PM EST until January 04 at 12:30PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Salt River at Shepherdsville affecting Bullitt County. .Heavy rain from the past 24 hours will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salt River at Shepherdsville. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, Water covers low spot of KY 61 at north end of bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 24.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tonight to 32.1 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 33.1 feet on 04/28/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
